hero.title: Ratopia’s Core Principles
hero.subtitle: The rattery’s core principles function as its guiding values in overall operation and management. Here, you can learn about Ratopia’s three primary principles as well as the accompanying Q&A section. These principles are not intended to suit every rattery or breeder. I maintain an attitude of seeking common ground while respecting differences, and welcome fellow breeders and adopters to discuss and reflect on the individual components of these ideas together.

body.text: Ratopia’s “rattery philosophy” consists of three main modules—husbandry, medical care, and breeding—along with a Q&A section. Husbandry focuses on space, enrichment, feeding, and stress management. Medical care emphasizes restraint under uncertainty and opposes excessive intervention. Breeding is grounded in record-keeping and risk control, and explicitly rejects extreme selective practices. The Q&A section addresses common points of controversy while clarifying boundaries and responsibilities. Together, these four components form a practical framework that is executable, reviewable, and open to evaluation.
